required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Modified CD19 CAR-T in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory CD19+ B-cell Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I, Open Label, Study of CXCR4 Modified CD19 CAR-T Therapy in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory CD19+ B-cell Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the safety and tolerance of modified CD19 CAR T cells in treating refractory/relapsed B-cell malignancies. CAR-T cells will be investigated as a single agent both in relapsed/refractory B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukaemia (B-ALL) and up to 60% of patients with B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL).

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years after modified CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after modified CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after modified CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of modified CD19 CAR-T cells to death or the last visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after modified CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of modified CD19 CAR-T cells to the occurrence of any event, including death, relapse, disease progression, and the last visit

arm_group.arm_group_label: Modified anti-CD19 CAR T cell therapy

intervention.arm_group_label: Modified anti-CD19 CAR T cell therapy

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Department of Medical Oncology
